oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Joe Barnhill Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Joe Barnhill (performer) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Joe Barnhill; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Biff Collie is being assisted with the setup of the recording -- (00:15) Collie does a numeric test before Joe Barnhill begins his first radio spot declaring he was with Collie -- (00:35) Joe Barnhill calls himself the new kid on the block while mentioning he and Collie are on the Music City Album Review and Collie gives suggestions -- (01:14) Barnhill radio spot about Ricky Van Shelton and Randy Travis and being the Co host of Collie's Music City Radio Review -- (01:24) Barnhill talks about "Good as Gone" and how his father co-wrote the song -- (02:14) Barnhill talks about how he would sit down with his publishers and father to rate songs based on radio and personal appeal before determine what tracks to put on the album -- (04:00) "Any Old Time" radio spot with Collie and Barnhill laughing -- (04:12) Collie and Barnhill talk about "Any Ole Time" and how Barnhill had to see if it had been put on hold for another artist -- (05:07) Barnhill misspeaks a couple times for his "The Chill of an Early Fall" radio spot -- (05:57) Barnhill describes "The Chill of an Early Fall" as a "different" song that touched him about loss -- (08:04) Barnhill talks about being at the Nashville Palace, how Randy Travis and Ricky Van Shelton had started there -- (09:25) Barnhill talks about washing dishes at a restaurant when the starting dishwasher did not show -- (10:18) Barnhill jokes about "Becky Morgan (Cotton Picking Time)" and how he has picked cotton while living in Texas -- (11:54) Barnhill talks about "Becky Morgan (Cotton Picking Time)" written by Paul Overstreet and Even Stevens being released by another band weeks before he had planned to release it -- (12:48) Barnhill talks about "Lucky Me, Lucky You" radio spot about Wayne Perry and how he became discovered -- (14:24) Barnhill talks about being born in Turkey, Texas and moving to California while his dad was in a recording group and eventually moving to Nashville -- (15:36) Barnhill talks about seeing others choosing similar paths of following their fathers and how he didn't want to bother his father with his music -- (16:38) Barnhill talks about performing in front of his father and a number of music legends as his first step to his father prepping him for the music industry -- (19:11) "For Crying Out Loud" is discussed by Barnhill as part of the transfer to Capitol Records from Universal Records that people wish he had saved for a single -- (20:36) Barnhill talks about his struggles when it comes to bringing soulful music to an album and his "It's All Coming Back to Me Now" track -- (22:02) Barnhill and Collie talk about the effect of releasing singles versus larger albums in correlation to success -- (24:03) "Special Occasions" radio spot featuring writer Wayne Perry told by Barnhill to be a follow up to "Your Old Flame's Goin Out Tonite" -- (25:35) Barnhill talks about Hank Thompson and his father working together -- (26:20) Barnhill talks about working late into the night and imaging songs -- (28:24) Barnhill talks about creating a test track and then pick apart the track before the real recording and overdub process -- (29:37) Barnhill talks about how he decides to do the mix down process -- (30:50) Barnhill's talks about how he segmented his album looking for tracks to record in various sections -- (32:30) Barnhill talks about being an unestablished artist and how song writers would want an established artist -- (33:40) "Tell Me Why I'm Still Crying Over You" radio spot and position of the track in the album (last) is discussed along with tempo -- (35:37) Collie asks Barnhill to do two radio spots about him being present with "The Biffer" and the Music City Album Review -- (36:05) Barnhill's thirty minute Music City Album Review radio spot break takes two attempts -- (36:53) Barnhill radio spot about the second thirty minute segment -- (37:04) Barnhill one-hour radio spot takes two attempts -- (37:35) Barnhill "See Ya" radio spot -- (37:45) Barnhill hour two radio spot -- (37:50) Collie recites and Barnhill performs two-hour radio spots and Barnhill jokes about the difficulty -- (38:15) Collie critiques Barnhill for not saying disc jockey -- (38:35) Barnhill does another take of thirty minutes left -- (38:52) Barnhill says "After this intermission" -- (39:06) Barnhill radio spot about finishing up the show -- (39:25) Collie has Barnhill thank Collie for having him -- (40:06) Barnhill radio spot about being a disc jockey -- (40:21) Barnhill radio spot of taking over for Collie -- (40:44) Barnhill recites his name for radio spot -- (41:08) Barnhill goodbye radio spot -- (41:11) Collie tells Barnhill about how he is a guinea pig for Collie's outros
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Barnhill, Joe; Collie, Biff;
